bug.short_desc: Annotation processing runs when annotation is on an incompatible target element

long_desc.thetext:
Csaba,
I understand you expect eclipse compiler to be consistent with Javac. Do you also have some documentation that might support this belief? I have been going through the documentation but unable to find anything specific. Particularly, I would also like to know if there are other scenarios where the annotation processors should not be called.
I googled for this and i did not find any relevant info. What documentation did you read?

(In reply to Csaba Kozk from comment #2) > I googled for this and i did not find any relevant info. What documentation > did you read?
I was referring to the API documentation for javax.annotation.*.
But I tend to agree with the report for two reasons: 1. It is consistent with Javac. 2. Obviously we will avoid wasting cycles by invoking processors unnecessarily.

Released in master for M7. Fix here:
http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/?id=efcbc8246985c2d4ce62d9f4d57040e9d6aab069
